reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Three short documentary films on community land rights in Indonesia

description.narrative: In the project, there will be produced three short documentary films about the struggle of the indigenous people to keep their indigenous territory. The films will highlight the actions taken by these groups to sustainably manage and use the community fore sts. The initiative by the Indonesian government regarding the management of community forests have not turned out successful. Meanwhile, forest-dependant communities have come with several different initiatives that should be noted worthwhile. Films will be shot in Tulungagung area (East Java), in Riau peninsula (Sumatra) and Buru island (Moluccas). The Riau film is related to the work of the Jikalahari network, which is also supported by Siemenpuu. Two other films are related to the work of Telapak and lo cal contacts. The films will be published in internet and as DVD, and it is intended to broadcast them in the local tv and villages vulnerable in respect of forest livelihoods. Siemenpuu and organizations supported by it can use these films in their own co mmunication. Telapak was established in early 1996 in Bogor by 7 environmentalist. It promotes sustainable use of natural resources. Telapak supports community-based natural resource management, which results in more sustainable forest management and promo tes the well-being of forest-dependant communities struggling with deforestation. The funding of Telapak comes partly from cooperatives and communities enterprises. Telapak is known for its multimedia campaigns, that target local, national and internationa l audience. The Gekko Studio responsible for film production works in alliance with Telapak. www.telapak.org
